Uploaded patch set 13: Commit message was updated.

Patch Set 13: Ok-To-Test+1

User approved, CI ok to start
I don't really understand this statement, but I'll review as I go further into your series.
Why would this be separate from RuleParmaterTraits?  Don't all rules need privileges?
Ok, I see the confusion, these should really be going into BaseRule.

Yes. I am inheriting this structure such that it will be available for all rules.
This separation was done to be able to add privileges to WebSockets and SseSockets.

Adding it to BaseRule wouldn't help as it is Templated.
I mean to say, it needs to return reference to self, so it looked good to keep it separate from BaseRule just like RuleParameterTraits and inherit it as and when required. 
These are like the Traits that belong to the respective rule.

I think I understand the response, but as a general design pattern I would like to avoid multiple inheritance and CRTP.  I realize we inherited CRTP from crow here, so if the new patch has some CRTP in it, I understand, but lets not make it worse than it already is.  I don't have the time this second to give you exact line by line guidance on what to do here, but I will try to get to it in the next few weeks.  If you have any ideas for how to avoid those two patterns and write simpler code, feel free to push it and I'll take a look.


As an aside, considering that this patch is now making the privileges() call required for all routes (which is a good thing btw) I wonder if it should be moved into the BMCWEB_ROUTE call, and we should remove the .privileges() method alltogether?  That would seem to match up with the intent of this patch.

Just thinking out loud.

This isn't true.  Examples of some routes without privileges assigned:

https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/0442ef92689d7719c89474a4fc81fbdaca7a4a96/redfish-core/lib/redfish_v1.hpp#L126


That's not to say I'm against this patch, but lets get the commit message to be accurate.
Modified the commit message. Please let me know if the new one sounds good.
This is a good one... Done.
When do you have time to do a testing? Do you need help?
Updated the Tested Section and Thank you 😊

Did you run redfish service validator? It could be useful in this case. What what endpoints did you check? All of them? It would be nice to know which endpoints were tested. Also word about expected results would be useful. I guess we want to have exactly same response before and after the change, since this commit is quite big one I would like to know if there is any visible change to user.

Code looks good, Let's use webui as test vehicle for this change where most of the URI's and method get exercised for completeness of testing.
One more thing: Since this change majorly impact the privilege, Lets add different privileges users and see some of the operations blocked when not authorized.
Suggested few more tests, Code looks good.
